detaileddescription.para: Protected version for use when descendents don't want to (or can't) provide the points for interpolation on construction.

memberdef.name: InterpolatedZeroInflationCurve

xrefdescription.para: Use the other overload and pass the base date directly instead of using a lag. A base rate should not be needed. Deprecated in version 1.34.

detaileddescription.para: The last date for which we have information.
When not set directly (the recommended option), it is calculated base on an observation lag relative to today.

briefdescription.para: the latest date for which the curve can return values

xrefdescription.para: Use the other overload and pass the base date directly as the first date in the vector instead of using a lag. Deprecated in version 1.34.

briefdescription.para: Inflation term structure based on the interpolation of zero rates.
